entry.title: Djangocong 14-15 Avril 2012 / Raphaël Barrois - Gérer un workflow avec xworkflows
entry.summary:
Description

Gérer un workflow avec xworkflows

Une solution pratique pour modéliser un processus métier —états, transitions— et attacher une logique spécifique sur chaque transition.

Intervenant: Raphaël Barrois

Slides: http://rencontres.django-fr.org/2012/presentations/xworkflows/

Site: http://rencontres.django-fr.org Realisation: http://www.guillaumebarbaz.com

entry.title: PyData London 2017 - Closing Notes
entry.summary:
Description

Filmed at PyData London 2017 www.pydata.org

PyData is a gathering of users and developers of data analysis tools in Python. The goals are to provide Python enthusiasts a place to share ideas and learn from each other about how best to apply our language and tools to ever-evolving challenges in the vast realm of data management, processing, analytics, and visualization.

We aim to be an accessible, community-driven conference, with tutorials for novices, advanced topical workshops for practitioners, and opportunities for package developers and users to meet in person.

entry.title: Python brasil [6] Cerimonia de abertura & infra-estrutura
PyOhio 2010: Lightning Talks
entry.summary:
Description

Lightning Talks

  • 00:00 - Eric Floehr: Hello World, Computer Programming for Kids and Beginners
  • 06:00 - Eric Floehr: lxml, suds, and Django
  • 11:40 - (sending people up for swag by rows)
  • 15:10 - Greg Malcolm: Distributed revision control (mercurial)
  • 23:55 - John Nielsen: Talking about threads in Python, the GIL and concurrency
  • 30:10 - Calvin Hendryx-Parker: Plone 4
  • 37:00 - Gloria Jacobs: Funky Python Tools

entry.title: PyOhio 2010: Python and Entrepreneurship
entry.summary:
Description

Python and Entrepeneurship

Featuring Eric Floehr, Nick Albright, Matt Wilson, Austin Godber, James Bonanno

One of the strengths of dynamic languages is rapid development and quick results. Python has been used by a number of Ohio small businesses, from supporting back-office operations to being the language the company's products are built on. This panel discussion will talk about the opportunities and challenges in using Python to build a business on, as well as a discussion on starting, running, and growing a technology-based business.

entry.title: PyOhio 2011: Python and Entrepreneurship
entry.summary:
Description

Python and Entrepeneurship

Panel: Eric Floehr, Matt Wilson, Isaac, Kelly, Carl Karsten

This will be an audience-led discussion with a number of Midwest entrepreneurs who do Python consulting, sell products built on Python, or who use Python as an integral part of their business operations.
